body:
Update:
After a short while, the same error is outputted and mount is destroyed.
Please try v1.50, error might be related to #3610

A similar error on the latest beta: v1.50.1-017-g0eaf5475-beta
Here is the error on that version: 
goroutine 36 [running]:
github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Conn).ReadRequest(0xc0002ca0c0, 0x16bac70, 0xc000308480, 0x191b720, 0xc00084e000)
        /home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:1007 +0x5118
github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve(0xc000308480, 0x18fdb40, 0xc00013b0a0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:414 +0x372
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.mount.func1(0xc000308480, 0xc00013b0a0, 0xc0002ca0c0, 0xc0002caa80)
        /home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount/mount.go:98 +0x45
created by github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.mount
        /home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount/mount.go:97 +0x2ee

Can you post the complete log?  What you posted doesn't actually show the problem :-(

Does running rclone work OK when not started from the boot sequence? What if you try it from a terminal windo without the `--daemon` flag?

The result is the same run from the terminal or as a daemon. It seems to mount fine but as soon as there is activity, say an md5 of a file (just as a test) it crashes. Here is a complete log, running v1.50.1-017-g0eaf5475-beta

I ls'd the directory and then ran md5 Functions.7z (just a random file in there)

issue.title: panic: opBmap on new FreeBSD 12.1-RELEASE

repository.name: fuse
repository.description: FUSE library for Go.   go get bazil.org/fuse

issue.body:
This issue was originally reported on the rclone repo: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3697

> I just updated my system to FreeBSD 12.1-RELEASE. Along with this release comes some improvements to fusefs, outlined here: https://svnweb.freebsd.org/base?view=revision&revision=352351
> Another notable change is the kernel module loaded is now fusefs.ko instead of fuse.ko

What appears to happen is that something in the new FUSE setup triggers this panic message

https://github.com/bazil/fuse/blob/65cc252bf6691cb3c7014bcb2c8dc29de91e3a7e/fuse.go#L1006-L1007
```
panic: opBmap

goroutine 27 [running]:
github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Conn).ReadRequest(0xc00007a3c0, 0x16bac70, 0xc00030e480, 0x191b720, 0xc00011c040)
/home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:1007 +0x5118
github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve(0xc00030e480, 0x18fdb40, 0xc000114660, 0x0, 0x0)
/home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:414 +0x372
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.mount.func1(0xc00030e480, 0xc000114660, 0xc00007a3c0, 0xc00007b0e0)
/home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount/mount.go:98 +0x45
created by github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.mount
/home/runner/work/rclone/src/github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount/mount.go:97 +0x2ee
```

Any help much appreciated :-)

body:
Ah, this looks like an unimplemented feature in the fuse library

https://github.com/bazil/fuse/blob/65cc252bf6691cb3c7014bcb2c8dc29de91e3a7e/fuse.go#L1006-L1007

I've reported an issue upstream: https://github.com/bazil/fuse/issues/221

Can you do another log with `-vv --debug-fuse` and post that please to help with the debugging please?

Sorry, I was quite busy today. Here is the log, as requested:

I appreciate the effort. That repo looks like it has hasn't had any commits for years. It would be nice to have it fixed upstream in some way but I understand that it is not ideal for you. Thanks for the latest beta!

Hi. You also can fix it by port patch.
Just add to /usr/ports/net/rclone/Makefile:
```
post-patch:
        @${REINPLACE_CMD} -e 's|panic("opBmap")|goto unrecognized|' ${WRKSRC}/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go
```
before line  `.include <bsd.port.mk>`

Complete Makefile looks like this:
```
# $FreeBSD: head/net/rclone/Makefile 518968 2019-12-03 21:50:58Z woodsb02 $

PORTNAME=       rclone
DISTVERSIONPREFIX=      v
DISTVERSION=    1.50.2
CATEGORIES=     net

MAINTAINER=     wg@FreeBSD.org
COMMENT=        Sync files to and from various cloud services

LICENSE=        MIT
LICENSE_FILE=   ${WRKSRC}/COPYING

USES=           go:modules
USE_GITHUB=     yes
GH_ACCOUNT=     ncw

PLIST_FILES=    bin/rclone

post-patch:
        @${REINPLACE_CMD} -e 's|panic("opBmap")|goto unrecognized|' ${WRKSRC}/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go

.include <bsd.port.mk>
```
I've tested mount with two remotes (yandex disk and s3 like), works fine last few hours.
